content.text:
# Berek, Republic of Tatarstan

}}
Berek () is a rural locality (a derevnya) in Yuğarı Oslan District, Tatarstan. The population was 51 as of 2010.
Geography
Berek is located 30 km south of Yuğarı Oslan, district's administrative centre, and 66 km southwest of Qazan, republic's capital, by road.
History
The village was established in 1926.
Until 1927 was a part of Zöyä Canton; after the creation of districts in Tatar ASSR (Tatarstan) in Tämte (1927–1931), Yuğarı Oslan (1931–1935),  Tämte (1935–1958), Yuğarı Oslan (1958–1963), Yäşel Üzän (1963–1965) and Yuğarı Oslan districts.
